Initialization¶

Examples¶

Round cells¶

from cpm_tools import *

w = 100
h = 100
ncells = 25
r = 5

# seed pixels
grid = seed_cells(w,h,ncells,pad=2*r,dist=2*r)

# add pixels to each seed to make circles
grid = grow_cells_round(grid,r)

# save to tiff
write_to_tiff(grid,'../images/cells_round.tiff')

Realistic cells¶

from cpm_tools import *

w = 100
h = 100
ncells = 25
volume = 80

# seed pixels
grid = seed_cells(w,h,ncells,pad=5)

# add pixels to each seed to make circles
grid = grow_cells_DLA(grid,volume)

# save to tiff
write_to_tiff(grid,'../images/cells_DLA.tiff')

Reference¶

cpm_tools.initialization.grow_cells_DLA(grid, volume)[source]¶

Grow cells using diffusion limited aggregation (DLA). Growth continues until all cells have the desired volume and cells cannot grow beyond that volume.

Parameters:
  • w – CPM grid
  • volume – cell volume

Returns: CPM grid

cpm_tools.initialization.grow_cells_round(grid, r)[source]¶

Grow seeded cells into circles

Parameters:
  • grid – CPM grid with seeded cells
  • r – cell radius

Returns: Numpy array representing sigma

cpm_tools.initialization.seed_cells(w, h, n, pad=10, dist=0, maxit=1000)[source]¶

Randomly place single pixels on the CPM grid. When the minimum distance is zero, cells are placed randomly without considering the position of other cells. When the minimum distance is larger than zero, the algorithm attempts to position the desired number of cells considering the minimum distance. To prevent an infinite run, the algorithm is stopped when the maximum number of iterations is reached.

Parameters:
  • w – grid width
  • h – grid height
  • n – number of cells
  • pad – padding between cells and border
  • dist – minimum distance between cells
  • maxit – maximum number of iterations per cells

Returns: CPM grid

cpm_tools.initialization.write_to_tiff(grid, fn)[source]¶

Save grid to tiff.

Parameters:
  • grid – CPM grid
  • fn – filename
